flavor: Evolving a Better You.
Perfecting the Imperfect.
"You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."
The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.

The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.
"Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."
Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.
Yip Yip!
When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.
Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.

Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…

The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
"Truth is a fickle mistress."
"Try to keep up."
"Don't waste my time."
A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.
"I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette

Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.
The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.
Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.
The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
Catch me if you can!
If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.

She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
"Why is a raven like a typing desk?"

She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?

"Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say-oops, too late, here we go!"
One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.
"The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"

You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.
